Learning Ruby with Project Euler
Posted on 24 January 2014 in programming and education

My favorite way to teach myself a new programming language is by completing Project Euler levels. Below, I have included some miscellaneous snippets of code I have used on Project Euler. I try not to share any spoilers, so my solutions are stored in a private repository on Github.

    def factorial(int)
  if int == 0
    return 1
  else
    return (1..int).reduce(:*)
  end
end

    def totient(num)
  primef = Prime.prime_division(num)
  tot = num
  primef.each do |p|
    tot *= 1 - (1.0/p[0])
  end
  return tot.to_i
end

    def factor(num)
  factors = Array.new
  (1..Math.sqrt(num)).each do |y| 
    if num % y == 0 then
       factors << [y,num/y] unless Math.sqrt(num) == y #or y == 1
    end
  end
  return factors
end

    def itoa(int)
  return int.to_s.chars.map { |x| x.to_i }
end
